author: Special Correspondent
text:
A three-member gang snatched a gold pendant from a 35-year-old tailor, V. Valarmathi of Kappalur, while she was returning home on Saturday night.

Police said that the woman who was working in a tailoring shop in Jaihindpuram was returning home on her two-wheeler when the trio overtook her on a motorbike under Kappalur Road overbridge.

Two of them, who were waiting on the road, pushed her down and tried to snatch her chain. The woman tried to resist, however, one of them managed to pull the imitation chain with the gold pendant.

Tirumangalam Town police are investigating.

In another incident, a two-sovereign gold chain was snatched from a woman pillion rider at Nalampuri Temple in GH Nagar under Subramaniyapuram police station limits on Saturday night.

The police said that three persons riding a motorbike snatched the chain while D. Krishnakumar (36) was returning home around 10.15 p.m. Subramaniyapuram police are investigating.
title: Robbers strike at two places
